definition: Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
surname Mi
rice/CL:粒[li4]/meter (classifier)
luxuriance of vegetation
see 蔽芾[bi4 fei4]

sentences.english: Yang CiGong without a glance, Mi Fu took the stone into the sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 杨次公连看也不看一眼，米芾就把石头装进袖中。

sentences.english: Actually, it was Mi Fu who accomplished such mission eventually.
sentences.chinese: 这一使命是由米芾来完成的。

sentences.english: Then analyzes the style of Mi Fu have the influence reason and the significance to the Southern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 然后分析米芾书风对南宋产生影响的原因和意义。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣

four famous Song calligraphers, namely: Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4], Huang Tingjian 黃庭堅|黄庭坚[Huang2 Ting2 jian1], Mi Fu 米芾[Mi3 Fu2] and Cai Xiang 蔡襄[Cai4 Xiang1]
Zhu Yunming (1460-1526), Ming dynasty calligrapher
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song

Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
extant work of a calligrapher
running script/semicursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
grass script/cursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
